alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hunterdon, southwestern Morris and northwestern Somerset Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Califon, or 11 miles northwest of Somerville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mendham, Peapack And Gladstone, Chester, Lebanon, Califon, Far Hills, White House Station, Long Valley and Bernardsville. This includes Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 20 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey.
